content:

I don’t like corn. Wow, what big watermelons! I like watermelons. I don’t like peaches. Where is the rabbit? Where is the corn, the peaches and the watermelons? I’m still hungry. Oh, a rabbit! What do you think of the little panda? ◆ Read again and answer A little panda sees a pumpkin. He wants to get it home. But it is too big and heavy. Then he sees a bear on a bike. “I have a good idea. I can roll the pumpkin home.” He rolls it home. His mother sees the pumpkin. “Oh! How can you get it home?” she asks. The little panda answers, “It’s very heavy, but I can roll it.” Picture story

content: 39 Picture story The Fisherman and the Fish A fisherman and his wife live in a small house by the sea. One day he catches a fish. 1. What does the fisherman’s wife want? 2. What does she want to be? 3. What does she get in the end? The fish says nothing and swims away. Then the fisherman and his wife are back in their small house again. Fish: Please let me go and I can give you anything. Fisherman: Fish: My wife wants a new house. Can you give one to her? Yes. She is in it now. Fisherman: Fish: My wife wants a palace. Can she have one? Go home. She is at the door. Fisherman: Fish: She wants to be a queen. Can she be a queen? OK. Fisherman: She also wants to be the queen of the sea. content:
44 Picture story The Old Man and His Hats An old man is selling hats. Some monkeys are looking at him in the tree. Then the old man has a good idea. He throws his hat down. The monkeys throw their hats down, too. The old man gets all his hats back. He is very happy. The old man wants to get his hats back. He is waving his hat. The monkeys are waving their hats, too. The old man is angry with them. He is stamping his feet.The monkeys are stamping their feet, too. The old man is tired. He is sleeping under the tree. The monkeys are taking his hats away. forty-four ◆ Read again and retell 
45 Make a picture book The elephants are drinking water. The cat is singing. The monkeys are jumping. forty-five ◆ Talk about your picture book A Picture Book This is my picture book. Look at the dog. It is running. The dogs are having a maths class.

content: 49 Picture story Father Christmas 1. What do children want from Father Christmas? 2. What is Mother Christmas doing? 3. How do the children feel? This is Father Christmas. He lives in Father Christmas House. Every child loves him. Every year, he gets many letters from children. They want toys and candies from him. Mother Christmas is making cakes and candies. Father Christmas is making toys for children. Father Christmas is bringing gifts to children on Christmas Eve. The children are opening the gifts. They are very happy. forty-nine ◆ Read again and answer

You’re right. Mike: Mum: What are you going to do, Mum? I’m going to buy a balloon for you. Mike: Mum: I’m hungry. Can I have some food? Yes, you can. Mum: Mike: Mum: What would you like? I’d like some bread and milk. OK. ◆ Listen again and act Look, listen and read

60 Can the little horse cross the river? A little horse is standing by the river. He wants to cross it, but he is afraid. A cow is eating grass near the river. She is big and strong. “Aunt Cow, can I cross the river?” “Yes, you can. It is not deep.” A squirrel is eating a nut. He is small. He has short legs. “Can I cross the river?” “No, you can’t. It is very deep.” 1. What does the cow say about the river? 2. What does the squirrel say about it? 3. Can the little horse cross the river? sixty ◆ Read again and answer Can the little horse cross the river? Can you tell him? Picture story
